description.full: This is one of the windowing systems used with openFrameworks when you build your OF app to run on an iOS device.

methods.name: setWindowPosition
methods.parameters: int x, int y

methods.name: setWindowShape
methods.parameters: int w, int h

methods.name: bEnableSetupScreen
methods.short: < This indicates the need/intent to draw a setup screen.

methods.name: bNewScreenMode
methods.short: < This indicates if a (new) window rectangle has to be adjusted.

methods.name: bShowCursor
methods.short: < Indicate the visibility of the (mouse) cursor.

methods.name: glesVersion
methods.short: < Indicate the version of OpenGL for Embedded Systems.

methods.name: isSurfaceInited
methods.short: < Indicate that the surface is (properly) initialized.

methods.name: isUsingX11
methods.short: < Indicate the use of the X Window System.

methods.name: isWindowInited
methods.short: < Indicate that the window is (properly) initialized.

methods.name: mouseScaleX
methods.short: < Amount by which to mouse movements along the X axis.

methods.name: mouseScaleY
methods.short: < Amount by which to mouse movements along the Y axis.

methods.name: nFramesSinceWindowResized
methods.short: < The number of frames passed/shown since the window got resized.

methods.name: x11Display
methods.short: < Indicate which X11 display is in use (currently).

methods.name: x11Screen
methods.short: < Indicate which X11 screen is in use (currently).

methods.name: x11ScreenNum
methods.short: < The number of the X11 screen is in use (currently).
